alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 23 at 2:34AM MST until February 23 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong winds in advance of an approaching cold front and upper disturbance will be combined with low humidities and a moderately unstable air mass. Several hours of critical conditions are most likely over Socorro and Valencia counties. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon today to 6 PM MST this evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley from noon today to 6 PM this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South 25 to 35 mph with gusts to between 50 and 60 mph. These strong winds are most likely over Socorro and Valencia counties. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
